utterance.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
utterance.content: Buddy, I’m going to have to move along.

utterance.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
utterance.content: Hey there. Excuse me? This is a restricted area.

utterance.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
utterance.content: Ma’am? Ma’am? Are you all right?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: We should go somewhere relaxing. You know, where we can just hang. Don’t you think?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Before we plan the honeymoon shouldn’t we set a wedding date first?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Because the department hasn’t even decided if you can have time off yet. Besides, planning a honeymoon will help us set a date.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. I can’t wait to hear about this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well you don’t want to go to Thailand during monsoon season, do you? Or New Zealand in the winter? No. You decide where you want to go, the best time to be there, boom. Lobby for those dates.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: New Zealand? Castle, are you using our honeymoon as an excuse to go and tour Middle Earth?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m game if you are.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I was hoping for something more romantic and less … hobbity.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why does everyone always think those two are mutually exclusive?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And it should be a place where neither one of us have ever been to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Agreed. A perfect spot that will be ours and ours alone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like Barcelona.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s where I took Meredith.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Um … Galapagos. I’ve always wanted to go there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Gina.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Part of our whirlwind honeymoon tour.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine. Swiss Alps. I hear they’re breathtaking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They are.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s where Meredith and I used to winter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? I think a better plan would be for you to make a list of places in the world that you have never honeymooned, vacationed, or married any of your other wives.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How hard could it be?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Albania and Finland. That’s all you got left?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, we traveled a lot. No, I’m sure I can think up some other places.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, my vote’s for someplace warmer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, maybe you’re right. Maybe we should just … focus on setting a date?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Ryan. What’s going on with Lanie?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, this case just hit a little close to home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why? What happened?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, security guard on the nightshift found out victim hanging from that beam. We ID’d her as Pam Hodges, 32.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hanging as in, by the neck?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. But what’s really bizarre is the way the victim looks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. Is that Lanie’s sister?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie doesn’t have a sister. Are Pam Hodges and Lanie related?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Nope. But they say we all have a twin out there somewhere. I guess this one’s mine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, we can deal with the preliminaries later.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I was shook up at first, but I’m fine now. She died between 2 and 4AM. Her neck did not break because the killer rigged the wires so her feet were just off the ground. She probably was strangled to death.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How does a wire that thin not snap?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s high test fishing line. Available at most sporting goods stores.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So then, it would have seemed as if she were just standing there on the dock.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s how she looked when we rolled up. It was freaky.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s what our killer was going for. He put her body on display to create a tableau. He’s confident. Brazen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, like he’d done it before?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Contact the FBI. See if they have any similar murders in their databases. Do we have an witnesses?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, not so far. The security guard rousted a homeless guy before he found the victim. Uniforms are still trying to track him down, see if he saw anything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do we know about Pan Hodges?

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She’s from Tampa, Florida where she lived on the fringes, racked up half a dozen busts for solicitation. This is her about a year ago. I’d say she came up in the world.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She looks a heck of a lot better now than she did back then. Aside from the being dead part.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why was she in New York?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We don’t know yet. She moved here seven months ago. New York drives license with a Brooklyn address.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, check her address. See if she’s got any family here.

utterance.speaker: CALVIN HODGES
utterance.content: Yes, Pam’s my niece. She stayed in my place for a few weeks when she moved to the city.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know why she came to town, Mr. Hodges?

utterance.speaker: CALVIN
utterance.content: Well, she said she needed a fresh start and she had a job offer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Doing what?

utterance.speaker: CALVIN
utterance.content: I was afraid Pam would start working the streets again. She burned a lot of bridges by telling her family she was going straight and never doing it. But this time was different. Pam moved out of my house like she said she would, she started working a job. A few months back I met her for lunch and I almost didn’t recognize her she looked so good. Pam was happy. She said this new job was just what she needed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What do you know about this job? Where did she work?

utterance.speaker: CALVIN
utterance.content: She wouldn’t talk about it much. Except to say that it was legit and she was being taken care of.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Do you know where she move to after she left your place?

utterance.speaker: CALVIN
utterance.content: She and I shared a cab that day and it dropped her off at a building off the West Side Highway. But I’ll tell you this. Pam took a big step up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A big step up? This is a giant leap. This is a – a vault into the stratosphere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How does a former streetwalker from Tampa afford a place like this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did she ever get any visitors? Possible she uh … worked out of the home?

utterance.speaker: GRAHAM
utterance.content: No sir. That is not possible.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then who paid for rent?

utterance.speaker: GRAHAM
utterance.content: Detective, we have a well-earned reputation for discretion and guarding the privacy of our clients.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Privacy ends when murder begins. Now I want the name of whoever is paying for this unit. And if you don’t have that then go get it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I love when you get angry. I mean, at other people besides me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, look at these coats. There’s at least $20 grand here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So whoever was paying her rent bought her wardrobe, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: These coats, this insane place, her history as a hooker, and now this job where she’s well taken care of?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All points to one thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was someone’s mistress.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And her sugar daddy hasn’t come forward or reported her missing. At the very least he knows about her life. At the very most he’s the one who took it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If Pam was a kept woman then he’s been to this apartment. I’m going to get ahold of CSU, have them sweep for prints so we can find out who’s been here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: While we’re at it we should take a look and see what’s on this. She might have taken a picture of him.

utterance.speaker: TECH AGENT TORI
utterance.content: It doesn’t look like she did. These are mostly standard tourist snapshots of New York.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No pictures of people, friends, boyfriends?

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: I haven’t found any so far.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Keep looking, okay? And check faces in the background, see if any of them show up again. Those photos might be our best bet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I take it that means we hit a wall on who rents the apartment?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The lease is held and paid for by Greg’s Baker, which is a shell corporation based of out Belize. And it was set up in such a way as to make it untraceable.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, what about phone records and credit cards? They must point to who Pam Hodges was spending time with.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She barely used her phone. And even though she racked up hug credit card bills it was mostly for shoes and clothes and hair salons. And it was paid for, monthly, by Greg’s Baker.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well what did CSU find at her apartment?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Her prints. No one else’s.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What the hell is going on here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. But someone is doing an incredible job of covering their tracks. Hey Lanie.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Kate. I need you to get down here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. We’re on our way.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Not Castle. Just you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Pam Hodges recently had cheek implants put in. It made her face broader. Like mine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Her hair products, her lipstick, her nail polish. They’re all the same as the ones I use.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, you’re just picking up on things that are similar with the victim.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: That’s what I kept telling myself. Then I found this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, all right. I’ve seen this before. It – it means inner strength.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I know what it means, Kate. Look.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I have the same exact tattoo in the same place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How is that even possible?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’s no accident we could be twins. Somebody went out of their way to make her look like me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait a minute. So you’re saying that Pam Hodges was trying to look like Lanie?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Given the tattoo and the surgery I just don’t see another explanation.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but why would she do that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because her sugar daddy wanted her to. Maybe he found her down in Tampa, shipped her up here, set her up in style. I mean, to a street walker that would seem like the greatest gig ever. All she’d have to do is let him remake her. Into Lanie.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, like Jimmy Stewart in Vertigo. Thanks, LT.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but even more twisted. So this guy has to know Lanie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Only she doesn’t seem to know him. But she’s still coming in to give us a statement. Now, what about the staff in Pam’s building? Did they give us any more details?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. None of them remember seeing any guys come to see her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, there might be another way for us to trace this guy. The cheek implants have serial numbers. Maybe that’ll lead us to Pam’s surgeon.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: There might be another reason why her sugar daddy’s lying low. The FBI database shows two other victims strangled with metal fishing line and their bodies staged. One in Miami, one in Fort Lauderdale, both unsolved, no suspects.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well our victim’s from Florida. Maybe he knew her from there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Order the homicide files, check them against our case. In the meantime canvass the stores and the salons Pam went to. Maybe she confided in someone or someone might have seen her with this guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: An ME investigates the murder of her own doppelganger. It would be a great story if Lanie weren’t living it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s something that we’re missing here, Castle. Two similar murders in Florida, our victim also from Florida? But then there’s this whole Lanie and her look-alike angle. How does that fit in?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. We got a hit on those cheek implants. They were traced to a Manhattan cosmetic surgeon, Dr. Kelly Nieman.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well I for one am very interested in what Dr. Nieman has to say.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: In the meantime Lanie wants to give her statement to Esposito.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’re not a perp, Lanie. It doesn’t seem right, us talking in here like this.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I wanted to be somewhere private, so … let’s get on with this, okay?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay. Um … so can you think of anyone who would do a thing like this?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who’ve you been with in the last six months? Besides me, I mean. I know we’re not exclusive.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No one.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I need the truth. Whatever it is.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’m telling you the truth.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Then how do they know about the tattoo? You’ve only had it three months, right? No one could see it unless you were naked.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well did you mention it to anyone?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Of course not.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: You are the only person I ever showed it to.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait … something is not right. This – this doesn’t make sense. C’mon, Lanie. Think. Someone got close to you. Someone saw that tattoo. Now who was it?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I had a weird night two months back.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Weird how?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Someone at work got promoted and a bunch of us hit a nightclub to celebrate. And some hot jazz was going so I stayed late. When I woke up the next day I couldn’t remember how I got home.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait, wait. Since when do you go busting your two drink limit?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I don’t. And I didn’t that night, either. What if this is when it happened? What if he put something in my drink and took me to my place and all of this started because of me?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I got your message. What’d you find?

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: Nothing in Pam’s pictures, but I scanned the camera’s memory card and I recovered a deleted picture file.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s our victim. When was this taken?

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: Based on the jpeg data, yesterday afternoon.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So just a few hours before she was killed. Let’s locate that marina and find out who owns that boat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD. I need –

utterance.speaker: BRYCE
utterance.content: I’m sorry. Do you have an appointment?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re here to see Dr. Nieman.

utterance.speaker: BRYCE
utterance.content: Can I ask what this is regarding?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BRYCE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Dr. Nieman, I apologize for the intrusion. This is -

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Detective Beckett. Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: As a tireless self-promoter, let me offer you one of my pens.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Thank you. We’re just here to ask you a few questions.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Oh, can I just say, you have an amazing face, Detective.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And uh, what … what about my face?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Uh … amazing potential.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why don’t we talk about Pam Hodges’s face? And the fact that she was murdered.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Jesus. What happened?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was one of your patients, is that correct?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Uh, yes. Yes. I preformed some refinements.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And at who’s behest?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Hers. She actually brought me a picture of a friend of hers. They had similar facial structure and Pam wanted to look a bit more like her friend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, so let me get this straight. People come in and ask to look like other people and you just do it?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Well it’s not unusual for patients to bring me photos, usually of models or actors, for reference.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And these photos she showed you, where were they taken?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: They looked like snapshots from a bar or a club, as I recall.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she ever come here with anyone? Did she even mention any of the men in her life?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: No, I’m afraid not.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And who was it that paid for these new cheeks of hers?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: She did. With a company check.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: From Greg’s Baker?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: I’d have to look, but that – that sounds right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … excuse me. Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Seriously. Amazing potential?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: And I’d love to help you realize it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, hey.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We tracked down that marina from the photo. It’s Windward Cove in Long Island. We’re here right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whose boat was Pam on?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s registered out of Florida to a Rudy Hollings.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so what do we know about him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not a damn thing, except Pam was on his boat the night she was murdered. We’re about to board. I’ll call you when it’s secure.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: SWAT TEAM MEMBER
utterance.content: NYPD! Police! Suspect up ahead. 12 o’clock. Let me see your hands! Hands!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Show me your hands! Right now!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hands! Now!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Espo, go outside. Don’t look, man.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What do you mean? What are you talking about, go outside? Huh? Let me see,

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s me.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: Our victim is Daniel Santos. Like Pam Hodges he was hung with fishing line. All though Santos shows no sign of cosmetic surgery, this killer, for reasons unknown, has clearly selected two victims who bear deliberate resemblance to members of our own police family. Now, what did the crime scene give us?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well there’s no prints or trace evidence. All we know is that the rig Santos was hung from was built from standard hardware store piping and that the fishing reel that fed the line was bought from a bait shop in North Carolina in 2005.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Where are we on the owner of the boat?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Rudy Hollings. He’s been in Spain for a year. He said he had no idea who would use his boat to commit a murder.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So somebody could have been aware of his travel plans.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s also possible if the killer knew boats, uh … they were looking for tell-tale signs that the boat wasn’t in use.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s probably why he picked it, Sir. He knew he could kill Daniel Santos undisturbed.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What do we know about Mr. Santos?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He moved here from Georgia about a year ago. I’m still trying to find a current address. I did speak with his parents. They told me he worked as a male stripper. Three months ago he called his parents to tell them he quit stripping and he’d landed a big time gig.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Did they know what this gig was?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. He was vague. Just like Pam Hodges.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Okay. So, I need you, Detective Esposito, and Dr. Parrish to go over all the cases that you worked together. See if anyone connected to them presents as a suspect.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yes, sir.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: For the sake of these victims and our own people, find this killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I still don’t get it. Why would someone kill clones of Esposito and Lanie? Is it some kind of warning?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe if we dig deeper into Daniel Santos’s life we’ll figure it out. I think I’ve got a leas as to what he was up to. According to his prepaid debit card records, he bought a latte at the same Midtown building every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday afternoon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: As if he was keeping some sort of regular appointment?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He did. According to the doorman, he was meeting with a Dr. Ian Fuller. He’s some kind of therapist.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah, so Daniel was from Georgia. Was he trying to get rid of his southern accent?

utterance.speaker: FULLER
utterance.content: Oh, more than that. He wanted to change his entire speech pattern.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To what end?

utterance.speaker: FULLER
utterance.content: He didn’t say, but he was very determined and very specific about his goals. He ever brought in an audio file of how he wanted to sound.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you have the file?

utterance.speaker: FULLER
utterance.content: Yeah, I have it right here. Let me just pull it up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s true. For example, I’m former military, which makes me an expert marksman. I’m usually the first through the door.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s Esposito.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m definitely the physical one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s from the documentary we shot at the precinct. Santos wasn’t just a lookalike. He was a soundalike.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: His face, the way he cut his hair, and now he’s trying to talk like me, too? What kind of sicko is doing this?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I went through every case we worked on and nothing jumped out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, not for me, either. There’s gotta be – it’s gotta be something personal. It’s gotta be someone who knows about our relationship.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, whoever he is he’s a freak. He made Daniel Santos suffer. Look at the bleeding underneath the skin. That wire bit into his neck for hours before he died. He used that fishing reel to kill him slowly. So who is he going to go after now? You and me? Some version of Ryan and Beckett? What if this is just the beginning?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s gonna be okay. I promise. I won’t let anything happen to you.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah? What if something happens to you?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Dude. We’re having a moment here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sorry. I found the strip club where Santos worked. They had a home address for him in Queens.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So how’re you doing, man?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m fine. How are you?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s big, what you’re dealing with. I just want to put it out there that I’m here for you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Good to know, man.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The point is, sometimes talking about it helps.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So what, you want me to share my feelings now?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s what a lot of people would do.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right, fine. I want to find this piece of garbage, string him up, and see how he likes it. There, I shared a feeling. Happy now?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: See? Don’t you feel better?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ryan –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right. The super said that Daniel Santos hasn’t been around here very much lately –

utterance.speaker: THERESA
utterance.content: Oh my God. Daniel?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. No, actually. Detective Javier Esposito, NYPD.

utterance.speaker: THERESA
utterance.content: It’s like seeing a ghost. You look so much like him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. So you knew Daniel?

utterance.speaker: THERESA
utterance.content: Uh, not as much as I wanted to, but enough to know that he was better than what he did for a living.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We – we heard that he quit that job for some big time gig. Do you have any idea what that was?

utterance.speaker: THERESA
utterance.content: He said he couldn’t talk about it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did people come visit him?

utterance.speaker: THERESA
utterance.content: People didn’t visit Daniel. It was more like the other way around.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Meaning what?

utterance.speaker: THERESA
utterance.content: I’d see him … leave here and a limo would be waiting out front.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Was this recently?

utterance.speaker: THERESA
utterance.content: Yeah. One picked him up two nights ago.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The same night he was killed. Do you remember what that vehicle looked like?

utterance.speaker: THERESA
utterance.content: It was black. I mean, it was just a regular town car. But there was blue around the license plate.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait, do you mean blue neon?

utterance.speaker: THERESA
utterance.content: Yeah, that was it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Blue neon license plate frames. That’s the trademark of Blue Moon Limos.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That was the manager at the Blue Moon. He said he dropped Daniel Santos off at the apartment of the person who ordered it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well whoever it is is probably our killer. Did he give you a name?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Dr. Kelly Nieman.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well I would say she has amazing potential … as a murderer.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The doorman at her building confirms that Santos visited two nights ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And not for the first time. He said Santos was a frequent overnight guest of the good doctor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which directly connects her to both of our victims.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So are we to believe that Kelly Nieman overpowered Santos, a young man in his prime?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well she was more than capable. According to her bio, she has a blackbelt in both tae-kwon-do and ju-jitsu.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She also has boating experience and grew up in Florida. In fact, she was in Miami at a conference at the time of the other two murders.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Do we have any hard evidence linking her to these murders?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s been clear from the beginning that our killer is very careful.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So the answer is no.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: This entire case is circumstantial. Which means you’re going to need to break her. And you’ve got one shot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dr. Nieman. Thank you for coming in.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Was I offered a choice?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We need to ask you a few questions about your relationship with Daniel Santos.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Well, I no longer have one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you are aware that he’s dead.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: I watch the news.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You don’t seem terribly upset by it.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Well, I supposed I could fake it, or lie, but that’s just a tedious for you as it is for me. It was purely physical with us. You really are a beautiful woman. But not perfect. I could fix you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where did you go after he left your apartment?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: We stayed in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You didn’t go by a marina?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: I don’t have a boat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And yet his body was found on one. And prior to that, he was at your apartment.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Yes, but then he left my place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Around 10.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Daniel Santos spent his last day with you. Pam Hodges was a patient of yours. They were both murdered. They only person that they have in common is you. Now, you don’t expect me to believe that’s a coincidence, do you?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: It’s not a coincidence at all. Daniel referred Pam to me as a patient.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So they knew each other? We don’t have any evidence of that.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Well I’m sure you’ll find some if you keep looking. When she came in she said that he’d recommended her to me. Let me ask you something. Has it occurred to you that I’m being set up here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Set up by whom?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Maybe whoever did that knew of my connection to Daniel and Pam. Maybe this was part of their plan. To waste your time and mine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I doubt that.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: You’ll never prove that I was at those docks. Or some marina. Because I wasn’t. Besides, what possible motive would I have for killing anyone?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: I’ve dated lawyers. I know that if you don’t charge me I can leave.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: No hard feelings, Detective. We’re both professionals. You’re just doing your job. You seek justice and I seek perfection. In fact – – whenever you’re ready to take this to the next level … you come see me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ve got nothing, Castle. I – I can’t even tie her to the Florida murders except for the fact that she was in the area when they occurred.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can I say something that’ll … probably annoy you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Since when do you ask for permission?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Touché. What if Dr. Nieman isn’t our killer?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you saw her in there. She was toying with me, She’s involved in this. I can feel it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I admit she’s not warm and cuddly, but that doesn’t make her guilty.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How can you, of all people, believe her story?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because at this point it makes more sense than ours does. Just … consider this. All along this killer has been one step ahead of us. No evidence, no witnesses, phantom corporations. He – or she – has us chasing our tails. So why, suddenly, does this same person order a limo, placing her with Santos the night he died? Rookie mistake.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or maybe it’s not mistake at all. Maybe Kelly Nieman is playing a much deeper game. Maybe she’s so confident that we can’t tie her to these murders that she’s letting the trail lead straight back to her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Um … that’s looking pretty unlikely.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Her alibi’s iron clad. She’s no good for either murders. But we might have found somebody who is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Told you.

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: This is from a traffic cam a block from Kelly Nieman’s apartment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s Daniel Santos.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The time code is 10:07, so Kelly was telling the truth. He did leave around 10.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Now, watch this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can we get a closer look at the driver?

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: No, this is our only angle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, whoever he is, Santos knows him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Now we tried running the plate, but it was stolen of another car, so no good there. But Tori noticed the decal on the back window.

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: It’s a parking pass.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For Coral Way Marina in Miami.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So whoever he is he could be connected to our Florida murders.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Called the marina. Even though the parking pass is expired they were able to tell us who it was issued to. One Carl Matthews.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And who is Carl Matthews?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Show us the DMV photo, please.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Recognize him now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s the security guard from the dock.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We now believe Carl Matthews killed Daniel Santos and Pam Hodges.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That security mook that found her? How did we let him slip away?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Matthews didn’t have a record. Nothing on him popped. Now, the day after Matthews found Pam Hodges dead he quit his job, saying he was too upset to work. Now he’s in the wind.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I bet this scumbag did the Florida murders, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It looks that way. He crewed fishing charters in Florida, which means he knows his way around boats. Now in 2010 he went off the grid and then he resurfaced in New York about a year ago when he took a job at the docks.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What’s your next move?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ve got an alert out on Matthews and his car but our best bet is to get in contact with his family, his friends, coworkers, ex-wives. Someone in his life has to know where he is and what his next move might be.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any news?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, not yet. But we’ll find him. What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Carl Matthews is wrong. He doesn’t fit the story.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How doesn’t he fit?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In Florida he was basically a beach bum. Here he’s a security guard. How does a guy like that pull this off?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe he just … reads more intelligent than he is on paper.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about the money? Enough to put up Pam Hodges, and the surgery?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He robbed a bank. Or he was dealing drugs. I don’t know, you know. He fell off the grid after he left Florida.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Speaking of which, he’s in Florida. He’s off the grid. He’s never been arrested. Why the fixation with Lanie and Esposito?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t have all the answers, Castle. Not right now, at least. But all the evidence is pointing at Matthews.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I agree with you. I just don’t think he’s working alone. I think he has a partner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like who? Dr. Nieman?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Someone we’ve dealt with before.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: 3XK? 3XK is dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is he? And what if we find Carl Matthews’s name in his case files.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jerry Tyson fell off that bridge. It was a hundred foot drop into that water.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was his body ever found?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nobody could survive that fall.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jerry Tyson could.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, listen to yourself. There’s not a shred of evidence that Tyson is alive, let alone involved in this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tyson doesn’t leave evidence. Not unless he wants us to find it. Like that deleted photo. No evidence plus meticulous planning, that’s vintage 3XK. And this case has it in spades.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. You want to know some other 3XK classics? Using people that look like other people. Using a killer to act on his behalf. Beckett, how can you not see it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What I see is guilt that you feel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This isn’t about me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, when Tyson escaped he outsmarted all of us. But you’ve always blamed yourself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because I’m to blame! It’s him. It’s Jerry Tyson.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t chase ghosts, Castle. Okay? It isn’t worth it. Trust me.

utterance.speaker: FILE CLERK
utterance.content: Detective! Looks like the 3XK files are gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean they’re gone?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All of them? How?

utterance.speaker: FILE CLERK
utterance.content: Somebody must have signed them out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, let me know if you can think of anything else, all right? Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where are the 3XK files?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you talking about? Your name is on the signature sheet.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, it’s not.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, from three days ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You checked those files out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I didn’t check out any files. Somebody messed up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh my god.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Somebody want to tell us what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That was the head of the ME’s office. Reports, lab work, DNA, tissue samples, of every suspected 3XK victim were checked out … by Lanie.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Only not the real Lanie.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Are you saying this son of a b*tch is back?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That explains the lookalikes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And why Santos tried to sound like me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not enough that Jerry Tyson disappeared, he wanted his murders to disappear, too. And it’s not just evidence. It’s his MOs, his victim preferences. All the hundreds of tiny case details that could reveal psychology as to where he is, where he might be going next. It’s all gone. It’s like he’s got a clean slate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe not completely clean. Call the prison where Tyson did time. Have them secure his records before they disappear too, and then have them send us the copies.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, I’m all over it.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: A cruiser just spotted Matthew’s car at the Starburst Motel in Queens.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s the same motel where we put up Jerry Tyson.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thanks. Front desk says he’s in room 47.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s the same room Tyson was in.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There’s his car. Lights out in room 47.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen, Castle. We don’t know what’s waiting for us up there. You stay here, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You be careful.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Police!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon! Where is 3XK? Where is he?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: How are you, Detective?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Depends on how things go down with Carl Matthews.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I’ll give you two the room. Good luck.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Thank you, sir.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: What kind of twisted bastard murders two people for some files?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That kind.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Do we have proof that he killed them?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not enough.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: So what’s going to happen?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’ll make him think that our case is stronger than it really is. Get him to confess. That’s our only play.

utterance.speaker: CARL MATTHEWS
utterance.content: You broke three of my ribs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I was going for double digits.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We need to have a candid conversation about your future, Carl.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or lack thereof.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We found a steel fishing line in that backpack you were carrying.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here’s a fun fact. Did you know when you cut a wire it leaves microscopic impressions - unique microscopic impressions – in the metal?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s how we knew that the wire in the pack came from the same spool you used to hang Daniel Santos.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We can also connect you to the murder of Pam Hodges. Same wire. Same cutting tool.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And to the murders in Florida.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh yes, where your fondness for fishing line was once again on display. But I think by this point in the trial the jurors will have heard enough.

utterance.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterance.content: Sounds like a lot of sticks and no carrots.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Confess to all the murders, Carl. And Florida will take the death penalty off the table. It’s the best you’re going to get. I’m giving you life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which is more than you ever gave your victims.

utterance.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterance.content: All right. I had a good run.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How many are there?

utterance.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterance.content: Way north of four, if that’s what you’re asking.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tell me about Pam Hodge.

utterance.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterance.content: She was a fighter. And the look on her face … she wanted to live so bad. But I stood her on a shipping pallet and then pulled it away. And her feet were just – just off the ground. I remember the toes of her shoes just scuffing the wood. All panicky and fast at first. And then slower. And then not at all.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what about Daniel Santos?

utterance.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterance.content: With Daniel I used the reel. So with each click I drew in a quarter inch of line. It got tighter and then lifted him, bit by bit. Every time I hear a click I’m right back with him.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: How long do you think it’s going to take before we stop thinking about what he’s done? Until we stop … looking at each other and seeing two dead people?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You killed them both for Jerry Tyson.

utterance.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterance.content: Oh, I admire his work. But no, I’m my own man.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And as your own man you groomed them, paid for Pam’s apartment using the money from the Greg’s Baker account that you established in the Caymans.

utterance.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re lying. That account was opened in Belize, not the Caymans.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you wouldn’t know that because you weren’t the one who opened it. Where’s Jerry Tyson?

utterance.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterance.content: Uh … he’s dead, is my understanding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So why did you do all of this to steal the 3XK files?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would you use the same motel, the same room, where Jerry Tyson escaped police custody?

utterance.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterance.content: Someone recommended it. Plus it had free wi-fi.

utterance.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterance.content: I’ll confess to my kills. No more and no less. I recall every one of them in the clearest detail. All those memories. And to me? I won’t be in a prison cell. I’ll be living here. I need a good pen and a pad of paper. Ah, several pads, in fact.

utterance.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterance.content: I know you think you’ve got this all figured out, but you don’t.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What did he saw about Jerry Tyson?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Mmm. The theft of those files was a major security breech. Be aware that the department is eager to put that behind them. It’s an embarrassment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, if a detective were to suggest that Tyson, a man that the department’s already declared dead, might still be alive –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: An even bigger embarrassment. So if you’re going to make that claim, make damn sure you can back it up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I will keep that in mind, sir.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was that about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That if Tyson is alive the NYPD doesn’t want to know about it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what about you? You think he’s back?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, people just don’t rise from the dead, so I’m still looking at other explanations. But if he is out there we have to find him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re not going to get any more out of Carl Matthews, so where do we start?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Guys, I think I found something in those prison records that got sent over. Do you remember right before he was released from prison Tyson got beat up by some inmates?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s why we pulled him out of there. We thought his life was in danger, but it turns out he just staged the whole thing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Right, but the beat down was real. He got sent to the infirmary. Look who was attending him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dr. Kelly Nieman?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She volunteered as a prison doc. More importantly she started there the week Tyson arrived and she quit the day he got released.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She knew him from before. She took that job to be close to him. She’s gotta be Tyson’s girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He taught her everything he knew. Get her back here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She’s not answering her cell. She’s not at her apartment either.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Damnit!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This explains why you couldn’t reach her. She bolted.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And if Tyson’s in this, he did too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seems like only yesterday this place was a thriving medical practice. Oh, it was yesterday.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We still gotta clear the place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. All right. Thanks. So, all of the electronic records from the 3XK cases were deleted, too. Not only that, it looks like our victims took evidence and files from twenty six other unsolved murders.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: More murders committed by Tyson?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or Kelly Nieman. I don’t know, Castle. I’m starting to think she’d be capable of it, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tyson sure did pick the right woman. Plus, she can change his appearance. Maybe she already has.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re still assuming that he’s alive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Aren’t you? He must be. Otherwise why orchestrate all this just to steal the files?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well maybe she just wanted to keep his memory alive. Or his legacy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That makes her just as dangerous as he is. And she’s still out there, somewhere, with Jerry Tyson or without him.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
